TITLE: Home listings are up more than 60% in some cities. Here's where
SUMMARY: Nationwide, active listings in August were up 36% compared with the same month last year, according to a new report from Realtor.com.

TITLE: Nobel winner Joseph Stiglitz says Fed raised rates ‘too far, too fast’ — and now needs to cut big
SUMMARY: Nobel Prize-winning economist Joseph Stiglitz believes the Federal Reserve should deliver a half-point interest rate cut at its forthcoming meeting

TITLE: How Gen Z outpaces past generations in the homeownership race
SUMMARY: In 2023, the homeownership rate for adult Gen Zers was higher than the homeownership rate for millennials and Gen X when they were 24, according to Redfin.

TITLE: London landlords sell up properties at record rates ahead of anticipated tax hikes
SUMMARY: London landlords are selling up their buy-to-let properties at record rates as anticipated tax hikes add further pressure to the once lucrative investment sector.

TITLE: Mortgage refinance demand is 94% higher than a year ago, as interest rates fall again
SUMMARY: Total mortgage application volume rose 1.6% last week, compared with the prior week, according to the Mortgage Bankers Association's seasonally adjusted index.

TITLE: JPMorgan economist says China's housing market crash is still not over
SUMMARY: China's troubled housing market could see prolonged softness, as a slew of government stimulus and supportive measures have not been "satisfactory."

TITLE: Rupert Murdoch's property group considers bid for UK's Rightmove, sending shares 21% higher
SUMMARY: Rupert Murdoch-owned REA Group said Monday it is contemplating a takeover offer for U.K. property portal Rightmove in a bid to create a global digital real estate business.

TITLE: The 'rent-first' lifestyle is catching on. From cars to clothes and even caskets, here's when it makes sense to buy vs. rent
SUMMARY: Younger adults are showing a preference for the renting lifestyle, studies show. In some cases, it also makes financial sense.

TITLE: Mortgage rates are falling, improving home buying conditions. Here's what to know before you act
SUMMARY: Experts give their best advice for navigating the housing market in the months ahead.

TITLE: You can buy mansions in these Mediterranean countries for the price of a studio in New York
SUMMARY: Manhattan real estate is notoriously expensive. You can trade in your 500 sq ft condo in the city for a 7,000 sq ft home in Sicily, according to My Dolce Casa.

TITLE: Weekly mortgage demand stalls, even though rates drop to lowest since April 2023
SUMMARY: Mortgage rates fell last week for the fourth straight week, but neither current homeowners nor homebuyers seemed particularly impressed.

TITLE: Home prices hit record high in June on S&P Case-Shiller Index
SUMMARY: On a three-month running average ending in June, prices nationally were 5.4% higher than they were in June 2023, according to data released Tuesday.

TITLE: 5 top money moves to consider before the Federal Reserve's first rate cut since 2020
SUMMARY: As soon as the Fed starts lowering interest rates, many types of consumer loans and savings products will be impacted. Here's how to make the most of it.

TITLE: A 'man-made disaster' could make it trickier to buy or sell a home in some areas this fall, real estate expert says
SUMMARY: Looming expiration for the largest U.S. flood insurance program may hold up some home sales this fall, just as the Federal Reserve is expected to cut interest rates.

TITLE: How the 2024 election could impact homebuilder stocks
SUMMARY: A housing shortage has supercharged the financial performance of large single-family homebuilders in the U.S. as the industry consolidates.

TITLE: Home sales rose in July for the first time in five months
SUMMARY: At the end of the month there were 1.33 million homes on the market, an increase of 0.8% from June and 19.8% higher than July 2023.

TITLE: After mini-boom, weekly mortgage refinance demand falls back 15%. Here's why
SUMMARY: Applications to refinance a home loan dropped 15% from the previous week, according to the Mortgage Bankers Association's seasonally adjusted index.

TITLE: 'Starter home' tax breaks, aid for first-time buyers: What to know about Harris' affordable housing proposals
SUMMARY: Vice President Kamala Harris introduced a slew of economic proposals for boosting housing supply. Here's what those proposals may mean for home buyers.

TITLE: Brits snap up lower mortgage deals as Bank of England rate cut boosts property market
SUMMARY: Britain's biggest high street lenders are continuing to slash borrowing costs after the Bank of England's first interest rate cut in four year sparked a boom in homebuyer activity.

TITLE: Op-ed: The case for a 40-year mortgage
SUMMARY: The American dream of owning a home is slipping away for many, an issue that entrepreneur John Hope Bryant writes can be addressed with 40-year mortgages.

TITLE: How to position yourself to benefit from the Fed's first rate cut in years, according to financial experts
SUMMARY: Many types of consumer loans and savings products will be impacted once the Fed starts lowering interest rates. Here's how to position yourself to benefit.

TITLE: A U.S. construction boom is sending rents lower and creating perks for renters
SUMMARY: Newly built apartment buildings are helping increase the supply of available rental units in some parts of the country. The result? Price cuts and added perks.

TITLE: Here's the inflation breakdown for July 2024 — in one chart
SUMMARY: The consumer price index has risen 2.9% since July 2023, the lowest annual reading since March 2021.

TITLE: Mortgage refinancing surges 35% in one week, as interest rates hit lowest level in over a year
SUMMARY: Applications to refinance a home loan surged 35% last week compared with the previous week, according to the Mortgage Bankers Association's seasonally adjusted index.

TITLE: Home equity is 'not like bread,' expert says — 'It won't go stale.' Here's when it makes sense to tap it
SUMMARY: If you're going to tap your home equity for extra cash, doing so for home repairs and maintenance makes sense, experts say.

TITLE: 59% of Americans wrongly think the U.S. is in a recession, report finds
SUMMARY: Although the economy is growing, consumers remain somewhat pessimistic.

TITLE: Insurers deemed mold too risky decades ago. That coverage gap still surprises homeowners
SUMMARY: Water damage, including mold, accounts for about a quarter of homeowners insurance losses, data shows. But consumers may find their insurance policy caps or excludes it.

TITLE: Tim Walz vs. JD Vance: What the 2024 presidential running mates could mean for your wallet
SUMMARY: Here's how Gov. Tim Walz and Sen. JD Vance compare on key personal finance issues like housing, the child tax credit and student loans.

TITLE: Weekly mortgage refinance demand soars 16% as rates sink to lowest level in over a year
SUMMARY: Mortgage interest rates dropped last week to the lowest level since May 2023, causing a surge in mortgage demand from both homebuyers and especially current homeowners.

TITLE: Mortgage rates plunge to the lowest level in more than a year after weak employment report
SUMMARY: The recent high on the 30-year fixed mortgage was 7.52% in late April, and home sales have been falling ever since.
